trans-unit.source: You can provide additional information about your app in the App declarations section of the App properties page during the submission process.
trans-unit.target: You can provide additional information about your app in the App declarations section of the App properties page during the submission process.

trans-unit.source: App declarations
trans-unit.target: App declarations

trans-unit.source: App declarations
trans-unit.target: App declarations

trans-unit.source: You can provide additional information about your app in the **App declarations** section of the **App properties** page during the [submission process](app-submissions.md).
trans-unit.target: You can provide additional information about your app in the **App declarations** section of the **App properties** page during the [submission process](app-submissions.md).

trans-unit.source: These declarations can help make sure your app is displayed appropriately and offered to the right set of customers, or can indicate how customers can use your app.
trans-unit.target: These declarations can help make sure your app is displayed appropriately and offered to the right set of customers, or can indicate how customers can use your app.

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe each declaration and what you need to consider when determining whether each declaration applies to your app.
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe each declaration and what you need to consider when determining whether each declaration applies to your app.

trans-unit.source: This app allows users to make purchases, but does not use the Windows Store commerce system.
trans-unit.target: This app allows users to make purchases, but does not use the Windows Store commerce system.

trans-unit.source: Most apps should leave this box unchecked, since apps which offer opportunities to make in-app purchases generally use the Microsoft in-app purchase API to create and [submit the IAPs](iap-submissions.md).
trans-unit.target: Most apps should leave this box unchecked, since apps which offer opportunities to make in-app purchases generally use the Microsoft in-app purchase API to create and [submit the IAPs](iap-submissions.md).

trans-unit.source: Per the [App Developer Agreement](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh694058), apps that were created and submitted prior to June 29, 2015, may continue to offer in-app purchasing functionality without using Microsoft's commerce engine, so long as the purchase functionality complies with the [Windows Store Policies](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn764944.aspx#pol_10_8).
trans-unit.target: Per the [App Developer Agreement](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh694058), apps that were created and submitted prior to June 29, 2015, may continue to offer in-app purchasing functionality without using Microsoft's commerce engine, so long as the purchase functionality complies with the [Windows Store Policies](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn764944.aspx#pol_10_8).

trans-unit.source: If this applies to your app, you must check this box.
trans-unit.target: If this applies to your app, you must check this box.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, leave it unchecked.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, leave it unchecked.

trans-unit.source: This app has been tested to meet accessibility guidelines.
trans-unit.target: This app has been tested to meet accessibility guidelines.

trans-unit.source: Checking this box makes your app discoverable to customers who are specifically looking for accessible apps in the Store.
trans-unit.target: Checking this box makes your app discoverable to customers who are specifically looking for accessible apps in the Store.

trans-unit.source: You should only check this box if you have done all of the following items:
trans-unit.target: You should only check this box if you have done all of the following items:

trans-unit.source: Set all the relevant accessibility info for UI elements, such as accessible names.
trans-unit.target: Set all the relevant accessibility info for UI elements, such as accessible names.

trans-unit.source: Implemented keyboard navigation and operations, taking into account tab order, keyboard activation, arrow keys navigation, shortcuts.
trans-unit.target: Implemented keyboard navigation and operations, taking into account tab order, keyboard activation, arrow keys navigation, shortcuts.

trans-unit.source: Ensured an accessible visual experience by including such things as a 4.5:1 text contrast ratio, and don't rely on color alone to convey info to the user.
trans-unit.target: Ensured an accessible visual experience by including such things as a 4.5:1 text contrast ratio, and don't rely on color alone to convey info to the user.

trans-unit.source: Used accessibility testing tools, such as Inspect or AccChecker, to verify your app, and resolve all high-priority errors detected by those tools.
trans-unit.target: Used accessibility testing tools, such as Inspect or AccChecker, to verify your app, and resolve all high-priority errors detected by those tools.

trans-unit.source: Verified the app’s key scenarios from end to end using such facilities and tools as Narrator, Magnifier, On Screen Keyboard, High Contrast, and High DPI.
trans-unit.target: Verified the app’s key scenarios from end to end using such facilities and tools as Narrator, Magnifier, On Screen Keyboard, High Contrast, and High DPI.

trans-unit.source: When you declare your app as accessible, you agree that your app is accessible to all customers, including those with disabilities.
trans-unit.target: When you declare your app as accessible, you agree that your app is accessible to all customers, including those with disabilities.

trans-unit.source: For example, this means you have tested the app with high-contrast mode and with a screen reader.
trans-unit.target: For example, this means you have tested the app with high-contrast mode and with a screen reader.

trans-unit.source: You've also verified that the user interface functions correctly with a keyboard, the Magnifier, and other accessibility tools.
trans-unit.target: You've also verified that the user interface functions correctly with a keyboard, the Magnifier, and other accessibility tools.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Accessibility for Windows Runtime apps](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263101), [Accessibility testing](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt297664), and [Accessibility in the Store](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt297663).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Accessibility for Windows Runtime apps](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263101), [Accessibility testing](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt297664), and [Accessibility in the Store](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt297663).

trans-unit.source: **Important** Don't list your app as accessible unless you have specifically engineered and tested it for that purpose.
trans-unit.target: **Important** Don't list your app as accessible unless you have specifically engineered and tested it for that purpose.

trans-unit.source: If your app is declared as accessible, but it doesn’t actually support accessibility, you'll probably receive negative feedback from the community.
trans-unit.target: If your app is declared as accessible, but it doesn’t actually support accessibility, you'll probably receive negative feedback from the community.

trans-unit.source: Customers can install this app to alternate drives or removable storage.
trans-unit.target: Customers can install this app to alternate drives or removable storage.

trans-unit.source: This box is checked by default, to allow customers to install your app to removable storage media such as an SD card, or to a non-system volume drive such as an external drive.
trans-unit.target: This box is checked by default, to allow customers to install your app to removable storage media such as an SD card, or to a non-system volume drive such as an external drive.

trans-unit.source: If you want to prevent your app from being installed to alternate drives or removable storage, uncheck this box.
trans-unit.target: If you want to prevent your app from being installed to alternate drives or removable storage, uncheck this box.

trans-unit.source: Note that there is no option to restrict installation so that an app can only be installed to removable storage media.
trans-unit.target: Note that there is no option to restrict installation so that an app can only be installed to removable storage media.

trans-unit.source: **Note** For Windows Phone 8.1, this was previously indicated via StoreManifest.xml.
trans-unit.target: **Note** For Windows Phone 8.1, this was previously indicated via StoreManifest.xml.

trans-unit.source: Windows can include this app's data in automatic backups to OneDrive.
trans-unit.target: Windows can include this app's data in automatic backups to OneDrive.

trans-unit.source: This box is checked by default, to allow your app's data to be included when a customer chooses to have Windows make automated backups to OneDrive.
trans-unit.target: This box is checked by default, to allow your app's data to be included when a customer chooses to have Windows make automated backups to OneDrive.

trans-unit.source: If you want to prevent your app's data from being included in automated backups, uncheck this box.
trans-unit.target: If you want to prevent your app's data from being included in automated backups, uncheck this box.

trans-unit.source: **Note** For Windows Phone 8.1, this was previously indicated via StoreManifest.xml.
trans-unit.target: **Note** For Windows Phone 8.1, this was previously indicated via StoreManifest.xml.
